text: when it comes to cooking with ground
beef it's very easy to get stuck in a
rut I'm guilty of it too
but today we're thinking outside the bun
and beyond the meatball and making beef
and cheddar hand pies they're easy to
make and you can form them ahead and
bake them from frozen whenever you're
ready to serve start by grading your
cheese okay I think that's about six
ounces now we can get to the stove and
start cooking now for the filling have a
large nonstick skillet heating over high
heat this is 80% lean ground beef it's
sometimes labeled as chuck same thing
just break it up a bit and a large onion
halved and thinly slice two cloves of
garlic that are minced it's gonna be
about a tablespoon and this all cooks
together until the meats browned no need
for olive oil or anything else break up
the meat into smaller pieces and this is
gonna take about six to seven minutes
and then we're done okay folks
no more Pink's so we can add in the rest
of our flavors Worcestershire I love
it's about ten ingredients in one and
also two teaspoons of Dijon mustard and
of course salt and pepper this is to
taste black pepper freshly ground always
give us a good stir and before we put
this into our pastry it does need to
cool down so I'm gonna transfer it to a
nice big bowl our filling is cooled to
room temperature and now we can start
rolling our puff pastry it's this
store-bought look for one that's all
butter they're more delicious that way
and it's a 12 ounce piece I've let it
fall completely in it's wrapping so you
can just sort of peel that off I like to
actually start it fold it in half and
roll it out here find you get a little
more layering and you'll want to lightly
flour your work surface at the top of
your pastry we're looking for 14-inch
square here so have a ruler on hand you
can also use a brush to remove any of
the excess flour you don't want that on
there you do not have to trim the edges
straight but I like to do that for
presentation purposes and these scraps
you can bake off in the oven I like to
sprinkle them with a little
cinnamon sugar and then this is going to
be cut into four equal squares now to
finish the deal your filling add in the
cheese I think that's good for me and
just fold that in gently and then evenly
divide the filling among the four
squares of puff right in the middle I
love a hand pie these are easy to make
but they feel kind of special before we
fold these up we do need to give them an
egg wash so that the pastry adheres to
itself okay and just brush the edges all
four edges of each pie now for the fun
bit start at one corner come up over the
filling you may need to press the
filling in a little bit toward the edges
and give it a little bit of a pinch this
is a forgiving pastry and it'll stretch
a little bit for you if you need to
stretch it at this point you should have
your oven already preheated to 425
degrees now to make these nice and
golden brown and give them a beautiful
sheen on top put some egg wash over the
pastry and very important to cut a few
vents in the top that will allow the
steam to escape as they cook otherwise
you could have an exploding pie gingerly
transfer these to a parchment lined
baking sheet and pop them in the freezer
for about 10 minutes this will just help
the pastry to set up and ensure that it
keeps its shape as it bakes in about 20
minutes
puffed and golden brown I have to have
one right now hot from the oven there's
still steam coming through the vents
take a peek inside that looks amazing I
like a little added heat I'm serving
these with roasted broccoli rabe and I
like a little bit of a red pepper flake
on those and on my hand pies now you
could serve these with a fork and knife
for a more elegant two-toned dinner but
because it's a hand pie I'm going to eat
it right out of my hand
mmm delicious happy eating
